elements.name: personal_life_goals
elements.title: What are your goals in life?

elements.name: company_name
elements.title: What is the company name?

elements.name: company_description
elements.title: What does the company do?

elements.name: business_core_values
elements.title: Please nominate 4 items that represent your business's core values.
elements.description: What is a core value? A company's core values underpin the guiding principles, code of conduct, and cultural code under which the business intends to operate. Core values are the fundamental beliefs of the business, and help the business determine if they are on the right path and correctly working towards their goals. Core values also drive decision making, helping individuals within the business make the right decisions by aligning the choice of decision with the company's core values.

elements.name: major_business_issues
elements.title: Please indicate, from your perspective, what do you consider to be the major issues within the business?
choices: The business is too reliant on key people
The house is not in order
There are internal problems with business partners and/or others on the team

elements.name: primary_focus_area
elements.title: Nominate which of the following areas requires the primary focus? Please make a selection from the following list.

elements.name: primary_focus_reason
elements.title: Why did you select this as the primary focus?

elements.name: secondary_focus_area
elements.title: Nominate which of the following areas requires secondary focus?  Please make a selection from the following list.

elements.name: secondary_focus_reason
elements.title: Why did you select this as the secondary focus?

elements.name: role_in_company_scenario
elements.title: Select the scenario that most closely describes your role in the company
choices: My role requires formal training and qualifications

elements.name: financial_role_description
elements.title: Select the scenario that most closely describes the financial position pertaining to your role in the company
choices: The company profit is my salary
My salary is budgeted separately (that is, I am paid a regular salary)

elements.name: salary_description
elements.title: Describe your salary
choices: My salary is sub industry/profession par
My salary is above industry/profession standard

elements.name: industry_type
elements.title: What industry are you in?
choices: Social, community, home care and disability services

elements.name: business_founded_by_you
elements.title: Did you start the business?

elements.name: business_acquisition_method
elements.title: How did you acquire the business?

elements.name: financial_performance_since_acquisition
elements.title: How is the business performing financially, compared to when you took over?

elements.name: performance_issues_description
elements.title: What are the reasons for this performance?
choices: Market conditions have affected the business
Products/services becoming less relevant or sought after

elements.name: detailed_explanation_performance_issues
elements.title: Please explain in more detail.

elements.name: turnaround_possibility
elements.title: Do you think the performance can be turned around?

elements.name: turnaround_impossibility_reason
elements.title: Why not?
choices: The industry or market has changed and the business isn't viable in this current form
There are too many problems internally within this business

elements.name: years_owning_business
elements.title: How many years have you had this business? (Please enter a number between 1 and 50)

elements.name: business_age
elements.title: How old is the business? (Please enter a number between 1 and 250)

elements.name: last_year_turnover
elements.title: What was your turnover last financial year?

elements.name: next_12_months_business_goal
elements.title: Over the next 12 months, I want to: (please select which of the following applies)
choices: Stay at our current level of turnover

elements.name: strategic_business_plan
elements.title: Do you have a strategic business plan?

elements.name: strategic_plan_last_review
elements.title: When was this last reviewed and updated?

elements.name: sells_physical_products
elements.title: Does your business sell physical products? (this includes food sold by a restaurant, products you manufacture as a manufacturer etc.)

elements.name: in_hospitality_sector
elements.title: Are you in Hospitality (eg. cafe, restaurant, take-away shop etc.)?

elements.name: manufactures_in_house
elements.title: Does your business manufacture or produce products in-house?

elements.name: custom_manufactured_by_another
elements.title: Does your business have anything custom manufactured or produced for it by another business?

elements.name: consider_in_house_manufacturing
elements.title: We need to consider manufacturing in house those products that are manufactured or produced for us by another business.

elements.name: consider_external_manufacturing
elements.title: We need to consider having products manufactured for us by another business.

elements.name: current_suppliers_appropriateness
elements.title: Our current suppliers are the right suppliers

elements.name: supplier_contracts_in_place
elements.title: We have supplier contracts in place

elements.name: exclusivity_agreements
elements.title: We have exclusivity agreements in place

elements.name: next_2_years_invest_more
elements.title: In the next 2 years we will need to invest more resources (money, people, time, machinery, equipment, space m2 etc.) into our manufacturing or production capacity

elements.name: util_production_equip
elements.title: What is the utilisation of your current production equipment? Meaning of 'Utilisation' in this instance:  The amount of time that equipment are being used for productive work. 100% is full capacity, fully utilised. 50% for example refers to equipment being used half the available time allocated to productive work, and in theory then have more capacity to produce.

elements.name: util_manufacturing_facility
elements.title: What is the utilisation of your current manufacturing facility? Meaning of 'Utilisation' in this instance:  The amount of space that is being used in your manufacturing facility for productive work. 100% is full capacity, fully utilised. 50% for example refers to only half the space being used for productive work, and in theory  there is more space to expand into.

elements.name: util_manufacturing_team
elements.title: What is the utilisation of your current manufacturing team? Meaning of 'Utilisation' in this instance:  The amount of time that the team's available hours are being used for productive work. 100% is full capacity, fully utilised. 50% for example refers to the team being used half the available time allocated to productive work and in theory they have more capacity to produce.

elements.name: imports_products
elements.title: Does your business import products?

elements.name: exports_products
elements.title: Does your business export products?

elements.name: has_intl_trading_plan
elements.title: Do you have an international trading plan in place?

elements.name: has_retail_stores
elements.title: Do you have any retail stores?

elements.name: sell_deliver_provide_services_any_type
elements.title: Does your business sell/deliver/provide services of any type?

elements.name: types_of_services
elements.title: Select the type(s) of service(s) that your business provides.

elements.name: physical_product_revenue_percentage
elements.title: What percentage (%) of revenue comes from selling physical products (includes manufactured products)?

elements.name: service_type_standard_or_custom
elements.title: Does your business provide standard services that can be easily cloned, or, do you provide custom solutions?

elements.name: revenue_from_custom_services
elements.title: What percentage (%) of revenue comes from providing custom services?

elements.name: last_time_reviewed_products_services
elements.title: When was the last time you completed a full review of your products/services?

elements.name: why_reviewed_products_services_now
elements.title: What prompted you to undertake this review?
choices: We just felt we needed to

elements.name: last_time_updated_prices
elements.title: When was the last time you updated your prices?

elements.name: why_update_prices_now
elements.title: What prompted you to undertake this review?
choices: We just felt we needed to

elements.name: rating_product_service_right_for_market
elements.title: Our products/services are the right ones for the market. Please indicate by selecting a score out of 10, where 1 is the lowest score (least likely) and 10 being the highest score (most likely).

elements.name: our_prices_are_the_same_as_that_of_competitors
elements.title: Our prices are the same as that of competitors

elements.name: our_productservice_mix_needs_to_change
elements.title: Our product/service mix needs to change

elements.name: our_customers_understand_our_productsservices
elements.title: Our customers understand our products/services

elements.name: products_services_still_relevant_in_2_yrs
elements.title: In 2 years time, our current products/services will still be relevant

elements.name: different_products_services_in_2_yrs
elements.title: In 2 years time we will be selling different products/services

elements.name: easy_supplier_access
elements.title: Anyone can easily access the suppliers of our products and become a reseller

elements.name: our_margins_are_higher_than_industry_standard
elements.title: Our margins are higher than industry standard
choices: No - our margins are the same as others
No - our margins are lower than others

elements.name: business_structure
elements.title: What is the business structure?

elements.name: is_sole_shareholder
elements.title: Are you the sole shareholder?

elements.title: How many other shareholders are there?

elements.name: is_director
elements.title: Are you a director?

elements.title: How many directors are there in total?

elements.name: all_directors_share_vision
elements.title: Do you believe all directors share the business's goals and vision?

elements.name: is_owner_also_ceo_gm
elements.title: Are you the owner and you also act as the CEO or General Manager of the business?

elements.name: is_ceo_and_gm_same_or_diff_people
elements.title: Are the CEO and General Manager roles held by the same person or different people?

elements.name: is_ceo_another_shareholder
elements.title: Is the CEO role held by another shareholder?

elements.name: can_the_business_operate_without_you
elements.title: Can the business operate without you?

elements.name: business_operate_completely_without_guidance

elements.name: how_much_is_the_business_reliant_on_you
elements.title: How much is the business reliant on you?

elements.name: when_you_are_not_around
elements.title: What happens in your business when you are not around, is there someone in charge?

elements.name: business_has_divisional_structure
elements.title: Does your business have a divisional structure? Such a structure has clear divisions, such as sales and marketing, production, etc, with each division consisting of its own team, including team leader or manager

elements.name: how_many_divisions_do_you_have
elements.title: How many divisions do you have?

elements.name: do_you_run_internal_management_meetings
elements.title: Do you run internal management meetings?

elements.name: mgmt_meeting_process
elements.title: Describe your management meeting process

elements.name: internal_mgmt_meetings_frequency
elements.title: How often do you run internal management meetings?

elements.name: do_you_run_internal_team_meetings
elements.title: Do you run internal team meetings?

elements.name: internal_team_meetings_frequency
elements.title: How often do you run internal team meetings?

elements.name: run_divisional_mgmt_meetings
elements.title: Do you run management meetings within your divisions?
choices: We don't run management meetings at all

elements.name: mgmt_meetings_frequency
elements.visibleIf: {run_divisional_mgmt_meetings} allof ['Yes in every division', 'Yes for some divisions']
elements.title: How often do you run management meetings? Please select as many as relevant. As an example, you may run meetings monthly in one division, while another runs them weekly. In such a case you would select both the weekly and the monthly options.

elements.name: mgmt_meetings_tools
elements.visibleIf: {run_divisional_mgmt_meetings} allof ['Yes in every division', 'Yes for some divisions']
elements.title: Which of the following do you use as part of managing these meetings? Select as many as are relevant.

elements.name: runs_divisional_team_meetings
elements.title: Do you run team meetings within these divisions?
choices: We don't run team meetings at all

elements.name: team_meetings_frequency
elements.visibleIf: {runs_divisional_team_meetings} allof ['Yes in every division', 'Yes for some divisions']
elements.title: How often do you run team meetings? Please select as many as relevant. As an example, you may run meetings monthly in one division, while another runs them weekly. In such a case you would select both the weekly and the monthly options.

elements.name: team_meetings_tools
elements.visibleIf: {runs_divisional_team_meetings} allof ['Yes in every division', 'Yes for some divisions']
elements.title: Which of the following do you use as part of managing these meetings? Select as many as are relevant.

elements.name: senior_mgmt_strategy_review_frequency
elements.title: How often does your senior management from all divisions get together to review business reports, business information, talk big picture strategy etc. with the senior executives/owners of the business?

elements.name: sr_mgmt_strategy_review_tools
elements.title: Which of the following do you use as part of managing these meetings? Select as many as are relevant.

elements.name: key_reports_review_frequency
elements.title: How often do you review key reports such as financial profit and loss statements, absenteeism reports, inventory reports etc.

elements.name: which_reports_do_you_review
elements.title: Further to the previous question, which reports do you review? Please select any from this list that are relevant.

elements.name: do_you_have_any_debts_in_the_business
elements.title: Do you have any debts in the business?

elements.name: list_business_debts
elements.title: Please list each debt along with the amount and term remaining.

elements.name: debt_repayment_consistency
elements.title: Are you always able to meet your repayment obligations?

elements.name: are_your_activity_statements_up_to_date
elements.title: Are your Activity Statements up to date?

elements.name: are_your_business_tax_returns_up_to_date
elements.title: Are your business tax returns up to date?

elements.title: Do you have a Bookkeeper?

elements.name: bookkeeper_internal_or_external
elements.title: Are they internal or external?

elements.name: accountant_meeting_freq
elements.title: How often do you meet with your accountant to discuss the financials of the business?

elements.title: Did your business generate an overall profit or loss for the last financial year?

elements.name: net_profit_amount_if_profitable
elements.title: What was the net profit?

elements.name: net_loss_amount_if_loss
elements.title: What was the net loss?

elements.name: reliance_on_financing_for_cash_flow
elements.title: Are you relying on financing to manage the cash flow within your business - such as overdraft facility?

elements.name: financing_options_used_for_cash_flow
elements.title: Which of these financing options do you use to fund cash flow?
choices: I put money into the business

elements.name: capital_needed_for_prepay
elements.title: Does the business require access to capital on an ongoing basis in order to pre-purchase goods/services?

elements.name: required_running_capital_amount
elements.title: How much running capital does the business require at any point in time?

elements.name: top_3_business_expenses
elements.title: What are the 3 biggest expenses in your business? (Please select at least 3.)

elements.name: other_expenses_specification
elements.title: Please advise what these other expenses are

elements.name: file_upload_last_three_years
elements.title:
Please upload the following documents from the last 3 full financial years, along with year to date documents for the current financial year:

* P&L
* Balance Sheet
* Asset Sheet

elements.name: total_employee_count
elements.title: How many people work for you, including permanent, casual, full time, part time staff and contractors?

elements.name: fte_count
elements.title: How many permanent full time employees do you have, NOT including yourself?

elements.name: pte_count
elements.title: How many permanent part time employees do you have?

elements.name: casual_emp_count
elements.title: How many casual employees do you have?

elements.name: contractor_count
elements.title: How many contractors do you have?

elements.title: Does the business outsource any work to third parties?

elements.name: percent_work_complete_3rd_parties
elements.title: What percentage (%) of the work is completed by third parties you outsource work to?

elements.name: has_3rd_party_service_level_agreements
elements.title: Do you have service level agreements in place with these third parties?

elements.name: team_position_descriptions
elements.title: Who do you have position descriptions for on your team?

elements.name: last_time_team_position_descriptions_reviewed
elements.title: When was the last time positions descriptions were reviewed and updated?

elements.name: has_hr_policies_and_procs
elements.title: Do you have HR policies and procedures in place?

elements.name: performance_review_freq
elements.title: How often do you conduct 1:1 performance reviews with your staff and contractors?

elements.name: busy_rating
elements.title: Out of 100%, please rate how busy your staff are, if you have staff. If you are a solo operator, please rate how busy you are. A higher value indicates the more busy they/you are, and vice versa.

elements.name: low_staff_busy_percentage_reason
elements.title: Why is this percentage so low?
choices: We have anticipated staff numbers to meet an upcoming period of growth
Our staff are not performing well

elements.name: underperforming_staff_identification
elements.title: Do you have any under-performing staff?

elements.name: staff_recruitment_need
elements.title: Does the business need to recruit any/more staff in the coming 6 months?

elements.name: staff_retention_threat_six_months
elements.title: Is the business at threat of losing at least one staff member in the coming 6 months?

elements.name: staffing_and_hr_challenges
elements.title: Does the business struggle with sourcing and selecting suitable staff, properly inducting them, recognising internal talent, identifying training requirements or exit procedures?

elements.name: team_cohesion_satisfaction
elements.title: Are you happy that your team is cohesive, interdependent, supportive of each other and functioning at the optimum level?

elements.name: has_succession_plan_in_place
elements.title: Do you have a succession plan in place? Succession planning is about future proofing your business. Whether you are seeking to remove yourself from the day-to-day running of the business, considering selling at some point in the future, or just planning long term for your retirement, succession planning is critical to your continuity of your business.

elements.name: succession_plan_proactive_implementation
elements.title: Is the plan being proactively implemented?

elements.name: succession_plan_effectiveness
elements.title: Is the plan working?

elements.name: succession_plan_for_business_continuity
elements.title: In the interests of business continuity and risk planning, is there someone on your current team who could take over your role in the event of death, illness or incapacity to continue.

elements.name: hr_metrics_tracking
elements.title: Do you measure HR related data such as absenteeism, annual leave etc.?

elements.name: measured_hr_data_types
elements.title: Which data do you measure?

elements.name: processes_documented
elements.title: Do you have all of the business processes and procedures documented?

elements.name: business_process_review_date
elements.title: When was the last time these were reviewed and updated?

elements.name: processes_and_systems_effectiveness_rating
elements.title: Rate the effectiveness of your processes and systems out of 10, with 10 being the highest score and 1 being the lowest score.

elements.title: Do you use any systems, software or tools to automate parts of your business?

elements.title: Do you review any operational reports on a regular basis?

elements.title: Do you have a sales and marketing strategy for the business?

elements.name: sales_marketing_strategy_review_date
elements.title: When was this last reviewed and updated?

elements.name: has_sales_marketing_plan
elements.title: Do you have a sales and marketing plan for the business?

elements.name: sales_marketing_plan_review_date
elements.title: When was this last reviewed and updated?

elements.name: sales_marketing_plan_implementation
elements.title: Is the plan actually being used to drive activities and implemented as set out in the plan?

elements.name: growth_areas_in_sales_marketing_plan
elements.title: Has your plan clearly identified those areas where you should pursue growth?

elements.name: do_you_have_a_clearly_articulated_sales_process
elements.title: Do you have a clearly articulated sales process?

elements.name: segmented_customer_list
elements.title: Do you have a clearly segmented customer list (including existing customers, lapsed customers and target prospects)?

elements.name: does_the_business_have_a_website
elements.title: Does the business have a website?

elements.name: website_last_updated_date
elements.title: When was it last updated (this could be in the form of a blog article or facelift for example)?

elements.name: does_your_business_have_a_style_guide
elements.title: Does your business have a style guide?

elements.name: style_guide_last_updated
elements.title: When was it last updated?

elements.name: premises_update_needed
elements.title: Do your physical premises, be it office, warehouse etc require any updating in terms of external appeal (such as new paint or logo refreshment etc.)? The reality is the people do 'judge the book by its cover',meaning that if your office or retail premise for example looks outdated, perhaps your logo is peeling off the sign or is faded, then those in themselves will affect the perception people will have of your business.

elements.name: brand_consistency_rating
elements.title: On a scale from 1 to 10 how consistent is your branding across all marketing materials and communication channels (eg. the logo is the same everywhere, colours are all the same, fonts are the same etc.)?

elements.name: total_marketing_budget
elements.title: How much do you spend per year, in total, on Sales and Marketing activities - offline and online (not including any employee wages)

elements.name: online_marketing_budget
elements.title: How much do you spend per year on online (digital) sales and marketing activities?

elements.name: offline_marketing_budget
elements.title: How much do you spend per year on offline sales and marketing activities?

elements.name: know_roi_for_all_money_spent_on_marketing
elements.title: Do you know the return on investment for every $ you spend on marketing?

elements.name: roi_per_dollar_spent_on_marketing
elements.title: What is the dollar return per dollar spent?

elements.name: do_you_track_and_monitor_sales_and_marketing_data
elements.title: Do you track and monitor sales and marketing data?

elements.name: method_for_capturing_sales_data
elements.title: How do you capture such data?

elements.name: understands_captured_sales_data
elements.title: Do you know what to do with the data you capture?

elements.name: sales_data_utilization_method
elements.title: What do you do with the data you collect?

elements.name: sales_marketing_satisfaction
elements.title: How happy are you with the results generated from your sales and marketing activities - rate out of 10 please.

elements.name: low_sales_results_reason
elements.title: Is there a specific reason why you gave the previous question such a low score?

elements.name: percentage_chance_of_losing_key_customers
elements.title: If you leave the business, or will be absent for any length of time (illness etc), what is the risk that the business will lose key customers? Please provide the percentage (%) that applies, with 0% indicating absolutely no chance of any customers leaving, and 100% indicating that the business will with 100% certainty lose key customers should you leave the business.

elements.name: has_crm
elements.title: Does the business have a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system?

elements.name: crm_system_effectiveness
elements.title: Does the business use this CRM system proactively and effectively? Please rate out of 10

elements.name: customer_data_utilization
elements.title: Do you capture and use data on customers to make informed business decisions and for future marketing activities?

elements.name: percentage_of_revenue_from_largest_customer
elements.title: What percentage (%) of your total revenue does your largest customer account for?

elements.name: percentage_of_revenue_from_top_3_customers
elements.title: What percentage (%) of your total revenue do your top 3 customers account for?

elements.name: active_customers_count
elements.title: Approximately how many active customers do you have (these are customers who purchased from you in the last 12 month period)?

elements.name: have_customers_on_service_or_supply_contracts
elements.title: Do you have customers on service or supply contracts that lock in their business with you?

elements.name: percentage_of_customers_on_service_contracts
elements.title: What percentage (%) of your customers are on service or supply contracts?

elements.name: has_dedicated_customer_service_person_or_team
elements.title: Do you have a dedicated customer service person or customer service team?

elements.name: customer_service_team_training
elements.title: Has this person or team been trained in how to interact with customers or resolve customer issues?

elements.name: has_customer_service_procedures_in_place
elements.title: Do you have customer service procedures in place - for example to handle things such as customer complaints, late payment problems etc?

elements.name: business_tech_stack
elements.title: Provide a list of technologies your business uses - example: gmail, accounting platform, crm type etc.

elements.name: process_reengineering_done
elements.title: Has the business ever gone through a Business Process Remodelling or Re-Engineering exercise?
choices: I have no idea what that is

elements.name: tech_sync_efficiency
elements.title: Does your technology sync with each other and help drive business processes?

elements.name: tech_support_access
elements.title: Do you have access to technology support service providers, such as an IT team?

elements.name: tech_rating_vs_competitors
elements.title: In terms of technology, rate your business out of 10 compared to your competitors

elements.name: future_modelling_understood
elements.title: Do you understand the term 'Future Modelling' for your business and the basic process behind it?

elements.name: operational_licenses_needed
elements.title: Does your business require any licences in order to operate (eg. licence to serve alcohol, forklift ticket, real estate agency licence etc)

elements.name: list_of_required_business_licenses
elements.title: Please list the required licences

elements.name: license_compliance_status
elements.title: Are your licences up to date?

elements.name: currently_facing_legal_actions
elements.title: Is your business currently facing any legal actions?

elements.name: regulatory_compliance
elements.title: Are there any regulations that your business must comply with?

elements.name: business_regulations_compliance_details
elements.title: Please advise

elements.name: premises_types
elements.title: Please select your premise type from the following list
choices: Other premise type such as childcare centre

elements.name: business_location_count
elements.title: How many locations does your business operate out of?

elements.name: does_the_business_own_any_properties
elements.title: Does the business own any properties?

elements.name: mortgage_duration_remaining
elements.title: How long does the mortgage have left on it? Please list for each owned property.

elements.name: leases_properties
elements.title: Does the business lease any properties?

elements.name: lease_duration_remaining
elements.title: How long does the lease have left on it? Please list for each leased property.

elements.name: property_upgrades_needed
elements.title: Do any of the properties (owned or leased) require any form of upgrade in the next 12 months (eg. New wall paint in the boardroom or fix a leaking roof)?

elements.name: strongest_advantage
elements.title: What do you believe is the single strongest (sustainable) advantage that you have over your competitors?

elements.name: main_competitor_analysis
elements.title: List your four main direct competitors. Qualify them using these as the guide: Size (Bigger, Smaller, Same). Prices (More Expensive, Less Expensive, Same). Quality (Better, Worse, Same). Strengths (e.g. part of buying group, good sales team, great reputation, very active marketing, well established etc). Weaknesses (e.g. poor reputation, poor range, no sales team, fail to adapt to market etc).
